instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: Best way to keep 15" models from using separate video chip?
threads.message: I've never tried using any type of utility to keep the 15" models from switching graphics so I'm wondering if there's a reliable way to do that. I'm wanting to try it with 2012/Early 2013 models and Late 2013/2014 models. Any tips?

threads.title: Best way to keep 15" models from using separate video chip?
Best way to keep 15" models from using separate video chip?
threads.message: Why are you wanting to do this? 3332 boards are repairable, and 3662/3787 boards aren't typically GPU issues. Just curious why you would do it?

threads.title: Best way to keep 15" models from using separate video chip?
threads.message: I don't know of a way to fix 3332 boards beyond the <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> fix which sometimes works, but many times doesn't hold up. And I'm getting a fair amount of video chip issue with the 3787 boards. I'm not sure what else to do with those beside try to shut down the graphics chip.
